intro: Tournefortia angustiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas or near freshwater sources. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
